4/Elon is the one person we know and perhaps the only person in the world who has the courage, brilliance, and skills to fix all of these and build the public square that we all hoped for and deserve.

3/While Twitter has great promise as a public square, it suffers from a myriad of difficult issues ranging from bots to abuse to censorship. Being a public company solely reliant on an advertising business model exacerbates all of these.
2/We invested, because we believe in Ev and Jack‚Äôs vision to connect the world and we believe in Elon‚Äôs brilliance to finally make it what it was meant to be.
1/First some news, we are joining Elon Musk‚Äôs bid for Twitter and investing $400MM into the company.

@vineetdont @Samirkaji @pmarca @a16z 1/ That's a bit of a rewriting of history. Netscape didn't die, it sold for $10B, which was a lot of money at the time. We also broke the Win32Api monopoly which lead to e.g. Google, FB, and others that MSFT would have crushed had it retained it's monopoly developer lock in.

@speirin @st_eppel @pmarca @a16z @E40 @ShakaSenghor @TiffanyHaddish The company is going to talk about this shortly, so I will leave it to them. The good news is that I believe they have more black investors in the A and B rounds than all other major social networks combined at the same stage.

@speirin @st_eppel @pmarca @a16z @E40 @ShakaSenghor @TiffanyHaddish I think the side effect (black people were essential in growing CH) is real, but it also shows the world the cultural power and influence of the community which is a good thing. And they will also ultimately the economic value.

@speirin @st_eppel @pmarca @a16z Our goal is to reverse the digital divide and get black people on the new technology first - social, crypto, bio everything. In CH, we worked to get people early access and gave away part of our deal allocation  to @E40, @ShakaSenghor, @TiffanyHaddish, and others who own a piece.
